website_summaries.verdict: A good climbing rope option for people looking for a safe and versatile option at an affordable price.
pros: Different lengths of rope fit different uses and climbing activities
Outer skin of the rope offers a lot of friction for better grip and braking performance during dangerous activities
cons: Rope can bind and twist along the D ring due to the tight weave

customer_reviews.title: Awesome static rope
customer_reviews.text: Got it for hiking gorges in the finger lakes. Works perfectly and is very well made and sturdy. Don't let the price or the made in China label fool you, this is good stuff, definitely heavy duty.
customer_reviews.author: x25064

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and durable product
customer_reviews.text: Great rope with user friendly clips on either end. I am using this as a porch lead for my daughter's two dogs who I watch when I come and visit but can't trust out on their own in the front yard. The rope keeps them safe, it doesn't wear like other dog leashes do on the cement and the cement stairs. This rope is sturdy and doing the trick. Love it. Thank you. S. Bradley, Oakland, CA, a very happy customer
customer_reviews.author: sobradley

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The product was exactly as described. It is a high quality climbing rope which can be used for many different applications where a solid braided rope with minimal static interference on the exterior surface. It was fairly priced. I would definitely buy this product from this vendor again.
customer_reviews.author: Donnie Hester

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Do not know if this is a good rope for serious rock climbing. But worked fine for suspending myself from a harness for a few minutes for a chore.
customer_reviews.author: ni3d4888

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing rope as far as we know
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to practice rappelling & harnessing situations as we learn canyoneering. Bought the 160 ft version. So far the rope has performed perfectly. Static, stiff enough to provide some of its own resistance going through rappelling scarabs yet still workable. We're newbies and taking this one step at a time, though, so we don't bring a whole lot of knowledge & experience to the table. But this rope has performed admirably. It comes with hardwoven metal-reinforced loops at each end.
customer_reviews.author: Tinkertestify

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was expecting! Purchased for and used as Public Safety SCUBA team tender lines. Very visible under water even when the clarity is only a few inches. Great product, great price!
customer_reviews.author: 802Diver

customer_reviews.title: great rope, will buy again
customer_reviews.text: excellent rope, holds up great to out door exposure in cold, heavy rain and heat, I using this as a runner for my active puppy and she's 50lbs and put it to the test, the rope held up great.
customer_reviews.author: KIJO SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Rope that busted with UV damage
customer_reviews.text: This was a nice rope for awhile. It only lasted for 8 month outside before UV destroyed its strength. I still use the broken portion as a dog rope on the harness when my dog goes swimming.
customer_reviews.author: Timbo K

customer_reviews.title: Great fast service
customer_reviews.text: Received static rope quickly. Not that clear about the difference between rappelling and climbing rope in original listing. Should be better described as static rope NOT for climbing, as it does not stretch to absorb a fall of a climber. Otherwise, great price and fast shipping.
customer_reviews.author: JeanPaul

customer_reviews.title: Not a climbing or repelling rope!
customer_reviews.text: As an avid rock climber I can say this rope is NOT! suitable for climbing. Although it is well built for its size it it just to thin, like a large paracord. It is not worth the risk to save a couple bucks, this is life were talking about. It would be great for other uses, or as an assesory cord. The loops and carabiners should never be used to support anything important. They are an embarrassment.
customer_reviews.author: Shane S

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR CLIMBING but good rope anyhow
customer_reviews.text: TL;DR Good buy, not for saving you from a drop but to keep you from dropping. Because this is a static rope its not meant for Extreme climbing. It doesn't stench like a climbing rope would, you would break your back falling off a wall. However for light stuff, climbing a tree or a small wall you should be fine but you will still hurt your back with a half harness. I was able to use this for pulling my truck out of the mud, wrapping it around the tow hitch on both ends a couple of times to make it thicc and it was able to hold just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Leo

customer_reviews.title: Worked well for a home-made swing.
customer_reviews.text: We used it to hang homemade swing. Had enough rope to have two strands on each side of the swing seat with an X underneath. Hardware is adequate for this purpose. Rope seems to be holding up well to frequent use.
customer_reviews.author: Gustav

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I used this for a righting line on my Hobie Cat 16 sailboat. Using this along with a righting pole I am able to right my Hobie 16 after a capsize single handed.
customer_reviews.author: Shepherd's Repair

customer_reviews.title: good quality rope, its braided and very strong, has nice carabeener ends.
customer_reviews.text: I used these for anchor rope for my life line. The ropes are well built and in beautiful colors. I will keep them for when I need to extend my anchor point. There are times when my 5/8 lifeline will not reach a tree or a strong anchor point. I was doing snow removal on roofs in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. A great product for a reasonable price. Also , they come with handy bags, I wrote the length of each rope on the bag with a sharpie.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel R Ball

customer_reviews.title: Durable and one of the good quality rope 👍👍👍
customer_reviews.text: This rope is definitely worth the money. Been looking at a different kind of rope to attach to my anchor and finally decided to get this one. Best decision ever. The material so sturdy and even the color is so nice. The carabiners are good because I can twist to lock. 😃😃 it is exactly what I need when I go kayak fishing.
customer_reviews.author: Beny Fam

customer_reviews.title: Roof Repair
customer_reviews.text: After over half a dozen roofers and a leaky roof remaining, my wife and I decided to try it ourselves (we can’t make it any worse, can we?). I purchased the harness, a rope, and a couple carabiners to provide a safety line while I’m on the roof. Removed flashing an fixed several leaks, one remains elusive, but I’ll get it too.
customer_reviews.author: Mithrandir's Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Good for everything but maybe not climbing
customer_reviews.text: I am using this for a dog tether in training recall (doggy please come back) for some naughty dogs who like to escape and and ignore me while they sniff and pee on everything they can just out of reach of me catching them, and it's perfect. I hitch it around my waist or an object at the park. Other ropes have been too small in diameter and bruised some easily when I was yanked. The rope seems sturdy enough for climbing, but as a climber I'm not certain I would trust it with my life (it's also too short). For other uses, it's fantastic! I'm going to get another one for camp utility.
customer_reviews.author: Saiorse

customer_reviews.title: good quality, has been outside for the last few ...
customer_reviews.text: Used to hang a monkey swing, good quality, has been outside for the last few months, no signs of trouble.
customer_reviews.author: PATRICK N

customer_reviews.title: The thimbles in the ends are NOT stainless steel
customer_reviews.text: Rope seems OK, but I cant stand a when the description is a flat out lie. Ive sold stainless for 22 years and these "thimbles " on the end are NOT stainless. They are magnetic as can be , and yes I understand Martinsitic stainless can have magnetic properties, IE a stainless fridge or appliance, but this is steel, NO DOUBT. The 3 typyes of stainless are Austinetic, Ferritic and Martinsetic .... look it up ..... false advertising.
customer_reviews.author: DP

customer_reviews.title: Strong
customer_reviews.text: Great rope !!!! Really really great rope with attachments bright so u can see well strong quality outdoor climbing rope .. I use mine for trimming trees so branched don't come me did the job. Came on time and very happy with this product .. Kids used for rope swing ..
customer_reviews.author: Dirty stay out!!!!!

customer_reviews.title: D-Rings were great Rope casing broke first time using
customer_reviews.text: Rope broke first time I used it. Looks like a good rope. But the outside cover ripped. D Rings held up ok though.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn P

customer_reviews.title: Good as expected
customer_reviews.text: I’ve seen a lot of people commenting on how this isn’t made for climbing. I’ve been climbing for a few months now and since I’ve used this rope, I’ve no issues. It hasn’t knotted or bunched up on me a single time. I’ve fallen on it with my entire weight from a few feet and didn’t feel any unnecessary discomfort. I think half the reviews on this product need to learn how to properly store their rope so it doesn’t tangle and maybe don’t spend as little money on a harness as you did for rope to avoid the overdramatic “jarring”.
customer_reviews.author: Michael C.

customer_reviews.title: Cheap, sturdy, strong.
customer_reviews.text: I got this as dog lead for my Siberian Husky. If you have a dog over 45 pounds- 150ppunds, I recommend this over the cheap "leads" they sell at petco. This rope will last forever if you treat it right (bring it inside at night Instead of leaving out side over night). It's also graded for 150 pound man climbing a Moutain lol. Great product and it's cheap.
customer_reviews.author: Carter Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: Only had one caribeaner. Good chinese rope.
customer_reviews.text: Im using this along with a 1280lb magnet to fish steel or iron out of creeks and lakes. Mine shipped with only one caribeaner. Not an issue, I have others. It isnt worth the hassle of sending it back and waiting for a new item. Rope quality seems good, but there isnt any specification included with the rope. The only tag on the rope is in chinese.
customer_reviews.author: ERROR404

customer_reviews.title: Not actually for climbing really tall things.
customer_reviews.text: Please do not buy this bargain rope to climb something. You will probably die. For a hammock it is AWESOME! I have two now and I can put my hammock anywhere I darn well please. Easy. Cheap. Relatively strong.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Butler

customer_reviews.title: Great Backpacking line!!!
customer_reviews.text: For the price... fantastic. Rope is strong, durable and not in question for my intended use as a light gear transfer line. The weight is slightly heavier than expected, but I will remove the carabiners and use my own when this rope is needed. I would not use this as a climbing rope. To much at stake when climbing vs. hoisting some equipment. Sorry, I am a label snob. Great product for my intended use.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: It is a viable climb rope but you get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: The ends are already permanently attached to carabiners which limits its usage to a degree some people may prefer this but it's not the most ideal situation also the rope is a climb rope and is weighted but it is not made very well compared to most ropes I've seen.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Deyton

customer_reviews.title: Looks alright
customer_reviews.text: It looks alright. I got this for all intensive purposes of adding to an emergency kit. I do not intend to use the carabinear that came attached to the rope though; they look real weak. I will be using my own carabinear. Otherwise, there are not frays or rub spots on the rope itself, so it looks like it is in decent condition for when it comes time to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Strong rope!
customer_reviews.text: I am using this rope to dig a percussion type well. Before purchasing this rope, I tried 3 other types. They all failed after very little use. (The rope is used to drop a steel cylinder into a well hole and retrieve it filled with dirt). This one, it has dug the well deeper than the other three combined and shows no sign of wear. It is a great rope.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Johnson

customer_reviews.title: I'm loving this rope...
customer_reviews.text: I'm using it as a long lead for my dog. It's the perfect thickness to be strong and still not tangle easily. I tied an alpine butterfly knot 4' from the end and another at 6' for handles when walking my dog in traffic or in normal conditions. I tied another on the other end to make a loop to go over one shoulder when my dog is exploring on a longer lead. It's ideal and I'm very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: GunNut37086

customer_reviews.title: Perfect low cost rope
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a safety rope for a roofing project. Did not want to go to the home-improvement store to buy a harness since I had a climbing one, I figured I would rig this rope up and tie it off and go from there. Have not done my roof project yet so wish me luck! Rope seems well-made though.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel O

customer_reviews.title: Tough, Sturdy Rope
customer_reviews.text: This rope is all that is promised in the description. It is very sturdy and there is no doubt it can carry the weight of a person. The provided carabiners are sturdy as well. It came rolled up in a nice carrying bag. This rope does not have any flex at all. So it is only a static rope and is not intended to be used to cushion falls.
customer_reviews.author: San

customer_reviews.title: Eyelets Don't hold up
customer_reviews.text: Over all the rope itself is a very nice material so far. I just started using it for the past two days. All its being used for is to be thrown over brush and trees not exceeding 20ft tall. The eyelets at each end are not holding up so good. I was hoping it would have lasted longer than what it is. Looks like I will be looking for a better quality somewhere else.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Jabtecki

customer_reviews.title: Climbing rope for my scuba diving gear
customer_reviews.text: Climbing rope for my scuba diving gear I bought this climbing rope for scuba diving gear while diver maneuver on the surface which is is really helpful to bring diving gear with this rope with hook it seems strong and well made for safety. It is also easy to release or tide down
customer_reviews.author: xtreme

customer_reviews.title: Don't hang a tree swing with it!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I must admit I didn't purchase the rope for climbing... but for hanging a tree swing. It doesn't work for that. So if you're looking for a climbing rope, feel free to disregard my review. If you're wondering if this will work well for a tree swing, keep looking. This will fray out rather quickly, resulting in sore tailbones and tears.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: I bought this rope for bringing down tree limbs for a tree that I have to drop in sections. I used a pulley that I have and I had no issues with it. The sections didn't weigh more then 200 pounds each. I had a couple of guys lowering it down. It worked well. When ordering it, I received it in a couple of days with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Great for a dog lead!
customer_reviews.text: In a desperate attempt to find a better dog lead that wouldn’t break within the first 3 months, I found this. This climbing rope works very well. It’s been out in the elements for a while now and is still holding its shape. Absolutely worth the buy.... if you’re using it as a dog lead. Not to sure on the rock climbing bit.
customer_reviews.author: New_Lady90

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: I will not use it as a climbing rope, too fragile.
customer_reviews.author: marc B

customer_reviews.title: great rope, buying more
customer_reviews.text: This rope is bad ass, I didn't use this for climbing, I used it to make sure giant 6" diameter logs didn't smash through my roof. I tugged on it with a truck, it held my body weight and more. I am buying more now for future uses or for the end of the year.
customer_reviews.author: Trenton Scalf

customer_reviews.title: Perfect safety line
customer_reviews.text: I needed to trim a tree branch that was 30 or so feet off the ground. I used an extension ladder but I wanted a safety net of sorts in case I fell. Hooking in to this line gave me that comfort level to continue. Very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable Quality
customer_reviews.text: Using this as a limiting device - fall prevention (not protection). Appears to be of good construction and quality. The carabineers are steel and a bit heavy with no markings. The storage bag is helpful. Reasonable buy as long as used fro the correct application.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a tie out rope!!
customer_reviews.text: We use this rope for a tie out rope for 1 of our calves. Works great! I wasn't sure if the hooked would hold up when I ordered but I was wrong they are easy to use and held up great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Frenchy

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best deal I have found on rope, I'm currently using my Xben outdoor climbing rope as a safety line when I'm climbing and it has not and does not show any signs of failing on me. Not only does the rope preform well but I shipped very fast and the customer service is very good. I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a secondary line to run or just a reliable spare.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Rope Time
customer_reviews.text: It is a good rope. I used it on a few hikes. I think for the price and usage it is great. I set up a h line on steep trails for my family to walk into more challenging spots.
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Cieplinski

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I was able to use this for pulling my truck out of the mud, wrapping it around the tow hitch on both ends a couple of times to make it thicc and it was able to hold just fine.So far the rope has performed perfectly. Static, stiff enough to provide some of its own resistance going through rappelling scarabs yet still workable. But this rope has performed admirably. It comes with hardwoven metal-reinforced loops at each end.
customer_reviews.author: Yvonne Perkin

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT drop line
customer_reviews.text: We use this to pull our canvas tool bucket up the tower - well built - quality and easy to use clips - very happy.
customer_reviews.author: 24GHz

customer_reviews.title: Good merchant
customer_reviews.text: My grand daughter works as a guide on a tree to tree rope course. She expressed her desire to receive the rope, a harness and caribiners as a school graduation gift. I bought these items for her. They arrived on time and were of the quality level she expected. She is delighted with all items.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Feels strong.
customer_reviews.text: I have yet to give it a real test run but so far it seems well made. The rope is a tad stiff and not as soft or as expected. A bit heavier than I thought also.
customer_reviews.author: GP

customer_reviews.title: Not good for tree work
customer_reviews.text: Not good for tree climbing. Used it once and felt very unsafe. Tangled way too much, didn’t feel sturdy for tree work.
customer_reviews.author: john j.

customer_reviews.title: Good rope replace the carabiners and the plastic wrap on the end of the cord
customer_reviews.text: The rope itself is very nice strong and durable. The plastic wrap they put on the end of the rope ends will Come off very quickly. The carabiners they use are strong but annoying. The screws to lock and unlock gets stuck if any debris gets in it. I would prefer to see a pull down twist to unlock style carabiner with this rope. Good value for money but please fix the optic wrap and the carabiners
customer_reviews.author: Ian

customer_reviews.title: Exactly as described, no complaints
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for some rigging in a photography/videography studio. The length and built-in eylets seemed ideal. I received it even quicker than anticipated, and the quality has been very good. It was also a good value
customer_reviews.author: TwoWheelsSunset

customer_reviews.title: Good quality rope
customer_reviews.text: Seems very good quality. I bought to keep in my jeep as a just-in-case rope if i ever need it for utility use. (Not for towing. This is NOT a tow rope.) The end eyelets are metal unlike some others and the included D-rings (are those D-rings?) seem pretty solid.
customer_reviews.author: Florian

customer_reviews.title: looks great.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't been able to break this rope in yet but from first looks and being able to mess around with it, it is very well built. Im using it to climb trees for hunting. I will be ordering a separate static line to tie to this for a lifeline. All in all looks like it will last a long time for what I bought it for.
customer_reviews.author: nick dimaio jr

customer_reviews.title: Great for a tree swing
customer_reviews.text: We use it to hang a swing in a tree and it has been great. With a lot of use it has no signs of fraying or wear.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn Sanders

customer_reviews.title: Good rope with poor accessories
customer_reviews.text: The rope appears to be good quality rope, however the bag appeared on arrival that it had been run over by a truck and both thimbles on the rope needed to be rebent. The carabiners are poor quality and should be replaced with a good quality device before any life safety use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Appears to be quality product
customer_reviews.text: Works great to keep me in the trees when I'm cutting down trees and trimming them. I believe it is a good product at a good price.
customer_reviews.author: sandman

customer_reviews.title: Great value rope!
customer_reviews.text: This rope is a great value for the money. It is a bit stiff to work with, but not overly so. I am using it mainly for a small Z rig kit.
customer_reviews.author: M. Molnar

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: I use this rope as a tie out for my 400lb. mini horse. The carabiner locks, and it bears his brute force. This is a great product for multiple uses. I don't climb, so I can't answer to that.
customer_reviews.author: terri s.

customer_reviews.title: It Will Be Your LifeLine !!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome - Very Well Made - Also Comes With Carabiners I Have No Regrets About Buying It..
customer_reviews.author: D49

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Very nice rope. Can be used for climbing. Using for roof safety also
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Good rope
customer_reviews.text: Good length of rope with built in durable eyelets. Did not use this for climbing, but to attach to netting to keep it aloft.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P. Grotenhuis

customer_reviews.title: Handy
customer_reviews.text: When I go out to the country I have to deal with a number of goalies and things this rope has come in handy we'll see how long it lasts cuz I normally leave it in place
customer_reviews.author: Randy Brown

customer_reviews.title: good
customer_reviews.text: this product is doing the job it was called for, that is being a safety line for a roofing job.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid scaling rope worth much more than it’s selling for
customer_reviews.text: Great arborist rope, helped us get some big trees down safely! Will buy again. This is a great product from our hardworking friends in China! Good job guys and girls! Can’t wait until you democratize! Held 170 lb climber for a 4 day project, 3hours of hard strain in the rope daily.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua M. Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when we fixed the gutter for extra safety. It’s in good quality, just like how it was described. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Iris Shihong

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding quality
customer_reviews.text: More bulky than I expected, but that is my fault for not paying close attention to description. Quality is pretty amazing.
customer_reviews.author: EyeLoveGlassesTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I took this rope with me on my weekend hiking trip incase I had to secure myself while climbing up or down something and it was perfect for that! It does not stretch, which is perfect and it's light weight so you can easily carry it around with you!
customer_reviews.author: Shortbread48

customer_reviews.title: Very durable like the carabiners.
customer_reviews.text: Not static enough for climbing but nice sturdy rope. Very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Patiola funaki

customer_reviews.title: It's ok - there is better elsewhwere
customer_reviews.text: Not super impressed with it. The packaging was lose and the rope was a tangled mess.
customer_reviews.author: James N.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. Very well made. Arrived on time. We would definitely recommend this product and would purchase it again. 👍
customer_reviews.author: R Baxter

customer_reviews.title: Great climbing rope!
customer_reviews.text: Well worth the purchase. I have used at least 8 different sets of gear, but this is one of the best.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Hall

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Used this rope to pull down huge vines grown into my 60ft+ trees. Worked great.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my kids to use when climbing a large backyard tree (also bought a kids harness). It’s very sturdy and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: P. Sands

customer_reviews.title: In my classroom emergency kit
customer_reviews.text: My classroom is on the second floor. I purchased this for emergency evacuations. Seems like a quality product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert K Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Great light task rope! Many universal uses!
customer_reviews.text: The rope is well packaged, includes a storage bag and is a great all around light task rope. Perfect for use on a small boat, kayak, camping, and as a light universal project rope. The bright orange 32’ really stands out and is very visible. I placed a regular sized pen next to the rope/bag in the first photo for a size comparison.
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Comes with storage bag
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made and I think it is a very good value.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick D. Mcginnis

customer_reviews.title: Great rope for outdoor swing
customer_reviews.text: Just right to hang a platform swing from a giant maple tree in our yard
customer_reviews.author: 3in2yrs

customer_reviews.title: The best rope to have on hand
customer_reviews.text: This is a great rope for just about any purpose. It also is very handy while camping or just as a backup during a survival situation.
customer_reviews.author: Alan Miller

customer_reviews.title: Greatly assisted in cutting down a tree.
customer_reviews.text: I rarely review anything but this rope was to good not to. I got this to pull down an extremely large tree. Over 100’ tall. My buddies thought for sure it would break. It worked great and I will be using it again. We did break one of the carabiners but if we looped it around the trailer hitch instead of connecting it with the carabiner it would have been fine. 10/10. I would definitely buy it again but I doubt I will need to.
customer_reviews.author: William L.

customer_reviews.title: Very good climbing rope
customer_reviews.text: Very strong material. The rope ring is made of metal, very durable.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: High quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a gift for my son. He was quite impressed with the quality and strength.
customer_reviews.author: tad a jach

customer_reviews.title: How much weight tension pull on the rope.
customer_reviews.text: Appears well made. I have no actually used the rope. I plan on carrying it in June while backpacking. So sorry couldn’t help out further.
customer_reviews.author: Victor J. Carro

customer_reviews.title: Appears strong !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not the intended use, but it helped tow a truck out of a mud hole.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A much have for anyone that has an active lifestyle
customer_reviews.text: Very handy to have around... Couldn't ask for a better rope
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap not for climbing or rappelling.
customer_reviews.text: Strong but started bunching. Used for rappeling and 5th time out bunching happened. Its now 45ft sections tied together for a tow strap. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Hgsports

customer_reviews.title: Very tough
customer_reviews.text: Being a 8mm rope it worked out great, wish I would of bought a thicker rope for rappelling. Great product still.
customer_reviews.author: Drew Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Peace of mind when hiking without cell service
customer_reviews.text: Nice rope. I bought it to carry for emergencies when mountain hiking away from phone service but ended up using it when taking down a tree.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Pickett

customer_reviews.title: Good for just in time or emergency use.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised. D rings secure well for rapid use. Good emergency rope.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Quality product
customer_reviews.text: I used this climbing rope to replace the worn hemp rope on my children's tree swing. So far, it has been holding up nicely. I have seen up to 4 children crammed onto the single swing, and I have seen no weakness or problems with the rope. I would purchase from this seller again.
customer_reviews.author: tengelpsyd

customer_reviews.title: It is what it is
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for an emergency kit we have. It works as described. Have recommended to many friends and family members
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Pleasant shopping experience
customer_reviews.text: I really like the ratio of this climbing rope to the relative climbing rope. This skin has a low sliding rate, is not easy to pilling, and has a good braking effect, and the operation is more stable. And it is of high quality and professional design, which is really a good choice.
customer_reviews.author: Pavitra S

customer_reviews.title: Just a climbing rope
customer_reviews.text: I love it sturdy and exactly what I needed, also a large atttachment on each end.
customer_reviews.author: suz

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Bought it to climb around on my roof as a safety rope . Works great
customer_reviews.author: CheeryM

customer_reviews.title: Great for tool bags!
customer_reviews.text: Great for its purpose, which is getting my tool bag up ladders!
customer_reviews.author: Monkey D Uzumaki

customer_reviews.title: Durable And..... durable
customer_reviews.text: Did a great job for tethering me while I cleaned the roof.
customer_reviews.author: mrgel

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Rope
customer_reviews.text: Rope as promised. Nice storage bag. Solid purchase. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Really nice setup and fast shipping
customer_reviews.text: Nice rig setup exactly what I was looking for at a good price. Also came in a nice carrying bag to keep clean and separate in my pack. Going to pair it with a grappling hook for emergencies boating, camping, exploring etc
customer_reviews.author: Bill Kaleta

customer_reviews.title: arrived on time
customer_reviews.text: it came quickly but brought with it lots of snow, we wanted to use it to trim blackberries over the bank and didn't want to try in the snow
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Griffin

customer_reviews.title: High quality Rope
customer_reviews.text: Was very pleased by the quality of the hardware used in this product. Excellent rope, color and performance. I have used it several times now to prune trees and support full size adults. Fast delivery too. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Thomas S. Goodman

customer_reviews.title: Safety rooe
customer_reviews.text: Used as a safety line for my tree stand. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: X XBEN Outdoor Climbing Rope 10M(32ft) 20M(64ft) 30M (96ft) 50M(160ft) 70M(230ft) Static Rock Climbing Rope, Escape Rope Ice Climbing Equipment Fire Rescue Parachute Rope
feature_bullets: Compare with competitors climbing rope, the outer skin sliding rate of our rope is low (less than 0.05%),not easy pilling and keep good braking function.The operation is more smooth.

High quality :Unlike other cheap stitch rope, our rope was made of 13 whole core rope(32ft, 64ft, 98ft, 160ft). Moderate softness and strong binding ability,outer skin twisted,more wear-resisting and durable

Professional design: Low ductility static rope can reduce the security risks caused by the extension of the rope, lightweight but strong strength,moderate size easy to control,easy to carry out after rolled
Widely application : Escape, Fire Survival, Backup, Climbing, Hiking, Camping, Downhill, Engineering protection, Lanyard, Tree Stand Accessories, Training, Aloft work, Caving, Abseiling, SRT etc.
Details: Both ends sewed with 2 hooks, Diameter: 8 mm, Pull(Max tensile force) :15 KN（3300lbs),Weight limited :300 kg
